channel.title: Grandprix.com News Feed
channel.author: Grandprix.ocm
channel.description: The source for Grand Prix news

item.title: Liberty shaping up to sell Formula 1 says Ecclestone
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone thinks Liberty Media could be shaping up to sell Formula 1.

item.title: Ferrari will write off 2021 says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari will "completely write off" the 2021 season, Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff predicts.

item.title: Three F1 faces not present in Istanbul
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Three familiar faces will be missing from the Istanbul paddock on Thursday.

item.title: Mercedes making F1 boring says Norris
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mercedes' dominance is "making Formula 1 boring", according to McLaren driver Lando Norris.

item.title: Tost uncomfortable about Honda engine uncertainty
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Franz Tost admits the engine situation for Red Bull's two Formula 1 teams is one "we would rather not be in".

item.title: Verstappen not an option for Mercedes says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Signing up Max Verstappen would not be good for Mercedes, according to team boss Toto Wolff.

item.title: Melbourne hopes for 50,000 F1 spectators
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Melbourne is targeting crowds of up to 50,000 per day as the Australian GP returns to Formula 1 next year following March's cancellation due to covid-19.

item.title: St Petersburg track now ready for F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: A circuit in St Petersburg appears to be ramping up its preparations for Formula 1.

item.title: Wolff to remain Mercedes team boss in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has announced that he will remain Mercedes team principal in 2021.

item.title: Hamilton could retire after 2021 says Chilton
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton could retire after becoming F1's first ever eight time world champion.

item.title: Montreal unsure F1's full 2021 calendar will be raced
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Canadian GP promoter Francois Dumontier is not so sure Formula 1's newly-published 2021 calendar will play out exactly as intended.

item.title: Albon would not accept Alpha Tauri demotion
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Alex Albon has denied that he might be happy to be demoted to Red Bull's second Formula 1 team.

item.title: No two-day race weekend format for Dutch GP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Formula 1 is not moving to a two-day race weekend format in 2021, according to Zandvoort circuit director Robert van Overdijk.

item.title: Formula 1 2021 provisional calendar announced
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Today F1 released a 2021 provisional calendar, which will be submitted to the World Motor Sport Council for approval.

item.title: Hamilton politics dangerous for F1 says Ralf Schumacher
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Political activism is "dangerous" in Formula 1, former driver Ralf Schumacher has warned.

item.title: Verstappen right to be realistic about 2021 chances
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Robert Doornbos thinks Max Verstappen is right to suspect that he will also not win the 2021 title with Red Bull.

item.title: Binotto confirms plan to skip races in 2020, 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto has confirmed reports that he will be absent this weekend in Istanbul.

item.title: Rookie lineup a mammoth task for Haas
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has admitted that running an all-rookie driver lineup next year is "a risk".

item.title: Verstappen ready to be F1 champion says Massa
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen only needs a car capable of going two tenths faster in order to race to a world championship.

item.title: F1 teams to rotate engineers from 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Even the smaller F1 teams will have to shake up their internal organisation to cope with the 23 scheduled grands prix next year.

item.title: Crash, covid infection hurt Stroll's form
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lance Stroll is suffering from a dip in confidence and the effects of his recent coronavirus infection, according to Racing Point.

item.title: Schumacher clearly ready for F1 debut
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mick Schumacher says he is "clearly" ready for Formula 1.

item.title: Red Bull may need Perez's sponsorship says Albers
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sergio Perez is still in the running to become Max Verstappen's next teammate at Red Bull, according to former F1 driver Christijan Albers.

item.title: Ferrari needs three years for F1 recovery says Berger
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: It will take Ferrari "three years" to put its championship ambitions back on track.

item.title: Honda leaving F1 for financial reasons says Carey
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Honda is leaving Formula 1 for financial reasons.

item.title: Steiner wants Haas to keep racing for 20
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner wants the Haas team to keep racing long after his retirement.

item.title: Road to F1 ending for Jean Alesi's son
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The road to Formula 1 for Jean Alesi's son appears to be over.

item.title: F1 will shine light on Saudi Arabia's problems says Lammers
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Controversy about the newly announced F1 race in Saudi Arabia will shine a light on the problems within the country.

item.title: Hamilton asked to condemn new Saudi Arabia GP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton has been urged to "speak out" against Formula 1's newly-announced 2021 race in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: No more F1 spectators in 2020
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The remaining four grands prix of 2020 look set to be held without spectators.

item.title: Vettel may return to top form in 2021 says Marko
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel could return to full power at Aston Martin next year, according to his former boss Dr Helmut Marko.

item.title: Steiner admits contact with Hulkenberg
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has revealed that he was recently in contact with Nico Hulkenberg

item.title: Unlucky to lose place in F1 says Magnussen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kevin Magnussen thinks he is "unlucky" to be losing his place in Formula 1.

item.title: Tsunoda told by Marko to focus on F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Dr Helmut Marko blocked Yuki Tsunoda from contesting a recent junior series race so that the Japanese can focus on Formula 1.

item.title: Alfa Romeo to remain independent in F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sauber, the company that races in F1 as Alfa Romeo, will remain an independent team.

item.title: Ralf Schumacher thinks Hamilton could retire
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ralf Schumacher thinks it is possible that Lewis Hamilton really will retire from Formula 1 after wrapping up his seventh title.

item.title: 2020 to be one-off slump season for Ferrari says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: 2020 is a one-off season of struggle for Ferrari, team boss Mattia Binotto insists.

item.title: Wurz hits out at Liberty's calendar plans
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Alex Wurz has hit out at Formula 1's plans to schedule longer and longer annual calendars by potentially shortening the race weekend format to just two days.

item.title: No interest in Mercedes switch or engine says Leclerc
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Charles Leclerc says he has no interest in moving to Mercedes - or even enjoying the superior power of the reigning world champions' dominant F1 engine.

item.title: Verstappen better than Red Bull car
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen is the only driver capable of mixing it with Mercedes' dominant cars in 2020.

item.title: Alonso working on F1 fitness in Bahrain
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso says he will be working on building up his neck muscles as he tests a two-year-old Renault this week in Bahrain.

item.title: Car upgrade successes good sign for future says Leclerc
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari is on the right track as the Maranello team moves to pull out of its competitive slump.

item.title: Costa thinks Mercedes will continue to dominate
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Aldo Costa says he doubts Mercedes can be beaten by any rival Formula 1 team any time soon.

item.title: Salo surprised as Raikkonen keeps racing in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mika Salo has admitted to surprise that Kimi Raikkonen will keep his longest-ever Formula 1 career alive into yet another season in 2021.

item.title: Verstappen not upset about missed F1 record
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen is not bothered that he will never be crowned the youngest world champion in Formula 1 history.

item.title: More gravel traps will improve the show says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto says installing more old-school gravel traps at Formula 1 circuits will help to "improve the show".

item.title: Haas a good place to start for Schumacher says Maylander
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Haas is a good first team for likely 2021 rookie Mick Schumacher.

item.title: Alpha Tauri preparing Tsunoda for 2021 debut
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Yuki Tsunoda is standing on the cusp of a busy period ahead of his almost certain 2021 debut for Alpha Tauri.

item.title: Jos Verstappen wants Hulkenberg to be son's teammate
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Jos Verstappen says that if he was running Red Bull, Nico Hulkenberg would replace Alex Albon and become his son Max's teammate in 2021.

item.title: Hamilton defends Russell after safety car crash
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fellow drivers are jumping to George Russell's defence after the Williams driver made an embarrassing mistake during the race at Imola.

item.title: Haas also opposed to Alonso's young driver test
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: A third team has revealed its opposition to Fernando Alonso's participation in the end-of-season 'young driver' test in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Grosjean definitely eyeing Indycar move
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Romain Grosjean has admitted that a move from Formula 1 to Indycar for 2021 cannot be ruled out.

item.title: Mercedes to keep black livery in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mercedes will keep its all-black livery in 2021, boss Toto Wolff has revealed.

item.title: Zandvoort still not confirming 2021 race date
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Organisers of the Dutch GP at Zandvoort are still not confirming the race date for its first grand prix since agreeing to return to Formula 1.

item.title: Race Analysis - Record seven
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Race Analysis

item.title: Wolff thinks tired Hamilton will stay in F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff remains confident that Lewis Hamilton will eventually sign a new Mercedes contract for 2021 and beyond.

item.title: Kvyat out but Marko gives Albon more time
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: While one Red Bull-contracted driver's exit appears set in stone, another still has a few races to prove he still belongs in Formula 1.

item.title: F1 should move to rotating races idea says Seidl
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Andreas Seidl has admitted his opposition to the trend for longer Formula 1 calendars made possible by the likely introduction of Imola-like two-day race weekends.

item.title: Covid threatens tail-end of 2020 season says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The rest of this year's makeshift Formula 1 calendar is in "the hands of the national authorities".

item.title: Race Notes - Hamilton wins again in Imola
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Race Notes

item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Sunday Photos

item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Sunday Press Conference

item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Sunday Team Quotes

item.title: Race Results
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Race Results

item.title: Ferrari, Renault reject Red Bull engine freeze
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Both Ferrari and Renault say they will not support Red Bull's push to see engine development frozen from 2022.

item.title: Marko all but confirms 2021 exit for Kvyat
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Dr Helmut Marko has all but officially confirmed that Daniil Kvyat will not keep his seat at Alpha Tauri beyond the end of 2020.

item.title: Haas asked Alfa Romeo to delay driver news
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: It is now obvious that Mick Schumacher will step up to Formula 1 next year with Haas.

item.title: Todt concerned about F1's ongoing corona crisis
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Jean Todt admits he is "very concerned" about the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Renault hopes FIA allows young driver test for Alonso
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Cyril Abiteboul is hoping the FIA might step in to allow Fernando Alonso to take part in the end-of-season 'young driver test' in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Kvyat slams track limits at Imola
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Daniil Kvyat has slammed the strict enforcement of 'track limits' this weekend as Imola makes an otherwise highly popular return to Formula 1.

item.title: Ferrari boss Binotto to skip next race in Turkey
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Laurent Mekies will step up and serve as Ferrari's acting team boss at the next race in Istanbul.

item.title: Definitely no F1 race seat in 2021 says Kubica
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Robert Kubica says he will "definitely" not be returning to Formula 1 as a race driver in 2021.

item.title: Todt admits to seeing Schumacher regularly
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: FIA president Jean Todt says he still goes to visit Michael Schumacher "regularly".

item.title: Qualifying Report - Edged
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Qualifying Report

item.title: Saturday Photos
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Saturday Photos

item.title: Saturday Press Conference
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Saturday Press Conference

item.title: Saturday Team Quotes
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Saturday Team Quotes

item.title: Qualifying Results
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Qualifying Results

item.title: Delicate driver salary cap not decided yet
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says news that his salary could be capped from 2023 caught him by "surprise".

item.title: Magnussen admits Red Bull seat not likely
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Haas' current F1 drivers do not sound keen on the idea of remaining in Formula 1 next year by becoming reserve drivers.

item.title: Racing Point blocked Abu Dhabi test for Alonso
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Racing Point vetoed Fernando Alonso's participation in the end of season 'young driver test' in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Schumacher at Haas would be an honour says Steiner
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Signing Mick Schumacher for 2021 would be "an honour", Haas boss Gunther Steiner has admitted.

item.title: Verstappen repeats Hulkenberg preference for 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Max Verstappen has repeated his view that Nico Hulkenberg would be a good teammate for him at Red Bull next year.

item.title: Russell staying at Williams in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: George Russell is staying at Williams next year, contrary to speculation that interim team boss Simon Roberts was flirting with Sergio Perez and his Mexican backers for 2021.

item.title: No room in F1 for entire Ferrari rookie trio says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Only one of the trio of top Ferrari 'academy' rookies will make it into Formula 1 next year.

item.title: Marko insists he has nothing against Gasly
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Red Bull needs Pierre Gasly to lead the Alpha Tauri team from the cockpit, according to Dr Helmut Marko.

item.title: Covid crisis becoming more difficult for F1
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Formula 1 is still nervous about the ongoing impact of coronavirus, Mercedes boss Toto Wolff admits.

item.title: Ferrari CEO plays down Aldo Costa rumours
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri has played down suggestions the Italian team could reunite with its former car designer Aldo Costa.

item.title: Modern F1 circuit design a shame says Zaffelli
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Jarno Zaffelli, a circuit designer involved in the modern version of Imola, says the current direction of Formula 1 track design is "a shame".

item.title: Wolff looking for new Mercedes team boss
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has admitted he is on the hunt for a new team principal for Mercedes.

item.title: F1 bosses defend controversial Saudi Arabia race
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Top F1 team bosses have defended the decision to add a new race in Saudi Arabia to the sport's unprecedented 23-round schedule for 2021.

item.title: Practice 1 Results
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Emilio Romagna GP - Practice 1 Results

item.title: Marko denies trying to blackmail Todt over engines
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Dr Helmut Marko has denied Jean Todt's charge that he is trying to "blackmail" the FIA president over his demands regarding Red Bull's engine decision for 2022.

item.title: Hamilton, Wolff futures to be decided this year
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lewis Hamilton has reassured his fans that he will remain in Formula 1 next year - even though he is yet sign a contract.

item.title: Raikkonen and Giovinazzi to stay with Alfa Romeo for 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The Alfa Romeo-Ferrari team has announced that drivers Kimi Raikkonen and Antonio Giovinazzi will continue with the team for the 2021 season.

item.title: Williams driver decision is commercial
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: George Russell's future is only in doubt because of "political and commercial" considerations at Williams.

item.title: Haas hints at Ferrari engine overheating
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Gunther Steiner has hinted that a major problem with Ferrari's struggling 2020 engine relates to overheating.

item.title: Alonso relationship working well says Prost
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Fernando Alonso's new relationship with Renault is already "working well", according to F1 legend and team advisor Alain Prost.

item.title: Vettel in dangerous Ferrari situation says Ralf Schumacher
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel may be playing a "dangerous" game as his relationship with Ferrari enters the final stretch.

item.title: Imola wants to stay on F1 calendar for next few years
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Imola wants to stay on the Formula 1 calendar beyond 2020.

item.title: Melbourne confirms covid-safe 2021 season opener
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Organisers of the Australian GP have confirmed that Melbourne will kick off the 2021 season.

item.title: Authorities ban spectators from Imola
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: At the eleventh hour, local authorities have banned spectators from this weekend's race at Imola.

item.title: Teams agree to $30m driver salary cap
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Formula 1 looks set to impose a salary cap for Formula 1 drivers.

item.title: Ferrari not aiming for 2021 title says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari's goal for 2021 is a return to podium positions, according to team boss Mattia Binotto.

item.title: Red Bull sets deadline for engine decision
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Red Bull has set a deadline for clarity about its engine plans for 2022.

item.title: Ecclestone told Aston Martin to sign Vettel
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone has revealed that he helped Sebastian Vettel to secure a seat at Aston Martin for 2021.

item.title: Hamilton plays poker with four aces
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone says it is "tragic" that those who laid the foundations of Mercedes' utter dominance of Formula 1 are not getting the credit.

item.title: Ecclestone tells Red Bull to sign Hulkenberg
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Half of Red Bull's Formula 1 driver lineups for 2020 remain uncertain.

item.title: Hamilton's political power surprises Ecclestone
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone is surprised about the success of Lewis Hamilton's political influence at Mercedes.

item.title: Gasly to continue with AlphaTauri in 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Scudiea AlphaTauri announed today that Pierre Gasly will continue to drive for the team for the 2021 season.

item.title: Norris apologises to Stroll, Hamilton
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Lando Norris has issued an apology after making comments about rivals Lewis Hamilton and Lance Stroll in Portimao.

item.title: Toto Wolff defends F1's pay drivers
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has defended some of F1's so-called 'pay drivers', insisting their disparaging image is unfair.

item.title: Abiteboul denies Ocon-Gasly rumours
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Cyril Abiteboul has denied rumours suggesting Renault might oust Esteban Ocon.

item.title: Ferrari not ready to discuss Red Bull engine freeze
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Red Bull's plans to run its own engine program from 2022 have hit a snag.

item.title: Binotto very happy with Sainz for 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto remains "very happy" with Ferrari's choice of successor for struggling quadruple world champion Sebastian Vettel.

item.title: Ecclestone says drivers still call for advice
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: On the occasion of his 90th birthday, former F1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone still thinks the move to today's power unit regulations was "insane".

item.title: F1 plans normal 23-race calendar for 2021
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: There could be as many as an unprecedented 23 races next year, as reports about the 2021 calendar emerge following a key meeting.

item.title: Mercedes ups Aston Martin stake to 20pc
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: The collaboration between Mercedes and Aston Martin is being expanded.

item.title: Rio de Janeiro F1 plans hit environmental snag
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Rio de Janeiro's hopes of securing a Formula 1 race have been dealt a blow.

item.title: Red Bull warns Verstappen over mongol insult
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Red Bull has told Max Verstappen to be more careful with his insults against rivals in future.

item.title: Portimao won by Mercedes, not by Hamilton
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Opinions remain split over how much credit Lewis Hamilton deserves for racing past Michael Schumacher's all-time F1 record for race victories in Portimao.

item.title: Hulkenberg waiting for call from Helmut Marko
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Alex Albon only has "two or three races" to prove to Red Bull that he should keep his race seat for 2021.

item.title: Key departures would weaken Mercedes says Schumacher
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: No Formula 1 team will be able to rival Mercedes' continuing dominance in 2021, according to Ralf Schumacher.

item.title: Leclerc car developments slowing Vettel says Villeneuve
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Jacques Villeneuve thinks all of Ferrari's car development in 2020 has been done to suit Charles Leclerc.

item.title: No mid-year changes to penalty points system says Masi
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: F1 race director Michael Masi has ruled out making any immediate changes to the controversial 'penalty points' system.

item.title: Race Analysis - Record Run
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Portuguese GP - Race Analysis

item.title: Russell thinks Perez camp fuelling Williams rumours
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: George Russell thinks rumours about his potential axing by Williams are being fuelled by the Sergio Perez camp.

item.title: Ferrari can't stop Red Bull engine says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Ferrari won't be able to block moves that would allow Red Bull to run its own works engine program from 2022.

item.title: Gasly teammate to be named after Bahrain says Marko
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Pierre Gasly is staying at Alpha Tauri next year, according to Dr Helmut Marko.

item.title: Hamilton's market value incredibly high says Wolff
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff admits that Lewis Hamilton's market value is currently "incredibly high".

item.title: Vettel's car identical to Leclerc's says Binotto
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mattia Binotto insists that Sebastian Vettel is being supplied with a car that is "identical" to the one driven by his Ferrari teammate Charles Leclerc.

item.title: Atmosphere relaxed after Haas news says Magnussen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Kevin Magnussen says he has no hard feelings after being told he is not needed by the Haas team for 2021.

item.title: Matching Ricciardo's pace a long process says Ocon
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Esteban Ocon admits it has been a "long process" to get back up to speed in Formula 1.

item.title: Mongolian politician criticises Verstappen
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: A Mongolian politician has questioned Red Bull's commitment to Formula 1's 'We Race As One' initiative.

item.title: Imola hopes F1 spectators not banned this weekend
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Organisers of this weekend's race at Imola hope local authorities will not ban spectators from attending.

item.title: Race Notes - Hamilton wins Portugal, takes win record
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Portuguese GP - Race Notes

item.title: Vettel admits Leclerc in different league
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Sebastian Vettel admits his teammate Charles Leclerc is currently in "a different league" with the 2020 Ferrari.

item.title: Albon doesn't mind Hulkenberg rumours
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Alex Albon insists he doesn't "mind" if Red Bull has been naming potential candidates to replace him for 2021.

item.title: Wolff supports Red Bull's push to take over Honda IP
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Toto Wolff has emerged in support of Red Bull's push to run its own works engine program from 2022.

item.title: Vitaly Petrov's father assassinated in Russia
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Vitaly Petrov has abruptly vacated his post as a F1 steward this weekend following the apparent assassination of his father in Russia.

item.title: Ocon hopes brutal F1 spares George Russell
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Esteban Ocon is hoping the sometimes "brutal" world of Formula 1 does not expel George Russell.

item.title: Schumacher absolutely ready for F1 debut
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Mick Schumacher insists he is "absolutely ready" to move into Formula 1 next year.

item.title: Haas has the worst car on the grid says Grosjean
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Haas' 2020 car is "the worst" in Formula 1 at present.

item.title: Qualifying Report - Pipped
item.author: Grandprix.com
item.description: Portuguese GP - Qualifying Report
